I know. I went to court during the first Trump term. I organized many  of my colleagues in both the House and the Senate to ask the courts to  enforce the emoluments clause, and we won in district court. Thanks to their tireless advocacy, H.R. 842 is the most cosponsored  bill in the 119th Congress with 339 cosponsors in the House and 68  cosponsors in the Senate.

I ask my colleagues to support this important legislation. Rest in  power, my sweet mother. We will beat cancer.

So that brings us to here, today, in this august Chamber of the U.S.  Senate, and we ask ourselves: OK, what do we do? What is our place  here?
